name: places/ChIJAcNYmcJv5kcR7EQ_IeMZp8c
adrFormatAddress: 31 Av. George V, 75008 Paris, France

displayName.text: Four Seasons Hotel George V, Paris

editorialSummary.text: Ornate, high-end hotel offering elegant rooms & suites, plus renown dining, a chic bar & luxe spa.

text.text:
I would like to share my wonderful experience at the Bar in Four Seasons George V. We visited as part of a bar tour for my friend’s birthday, and, of course, Four Seasons was at the top of our list. From the moment we arrived, everything was exceptional. The hostess gave us the best table with a warm welcome, and every detail of the service was impeccable.

A special thanks to our waitress, Eugenia, who truly made our evening unforgettable. She answered all our questions, introduced us to the bar’s concept and signature cocktails, and, upon learning about my friend’s birthday, surprised us with a thoughtful little gift.

Though we stayed for just an hour, the experience left us with memories we will cherish for a long time. Thank you!

originalText.text:
I would like to share my wonderful experience at the Bar in Four Seasons George V. We visited as part of a bar tour for my friend’s birthday, and, of course, Four Seasons was at the top of our list. From the moment we arrived, everything was exceptional. The hostess gave us the best table with a warm welcome, and every detail of the service was impeccable.

A special thanks to our waitress, Eugenia, who truly made our evening unforgettable. She answered all our questions, introduced us to the bar’s concept and signature cocktails, and, upon learning about my friend’s birthday, surprised us with a thoughtful little gift.

Though we stayed for just an hour, the experience left us with memories we will cherish for a long time. Thank you!

text.text:
The hotel has a good location close to various attractions in Paris. Overall, the entire hotel has a suitable mix of classic French charm and various modern installations.

The reception at the hotel met all Four Seasons standards and we were greeted personally by the hotel manager.

The concierge team was excellent in fulfilling all requests and reservations.

There are several restaurants and bars within the hotel. Tables are always kept free for hotel guests and there are no waiting times and the excellent service for which the Four Seasons are known.

The rooms are modern and designed in French charm. They are clean, spacious rooms. However, there is almost no view in this hotel (there might be some rooms with a small view of the eiffeltower). This is compensated for by a wonderful inner courtyard. This is ideal for relaxing between shopping and shields you from the hustle and bustle of the streets for a moment.

the spa is sensational and, in my opinion, this is a little understated. there is a spacious fitness room and a long swimming pool. it is one of the longest swimming pools of all the indoor pools at four seasons worldwide. the pool is not too wide. there is also a hot bath with jets. there are also steam rooms and the usual infrastructure of the four seasons spa. The classic "recreation area" is just as present in this hotel. The spa area is very modern but still has the described Parisian charm.
The employees are attentive, friendly and proactive in all areas. The hotel is somewhat more expensive within the Four Seasons chain, but was convincing in all areas and maintained the high standards. The many restaurant options within the hotel offer variety.

Some of the lifts are a little older.

text.text:
Some places are more than destinations; they become part of who we are. Returning to the George V this weekend was like stepping into a memory—one wrapped in history, beauty, and a sense of timeless elegance that never fades.
Paris feels different here. The grandeur of its halls, the breathtaking floral artistry that fills every corner, the way golden light dances across, the impeccable service where every detail whispers elegance.—it all feels like coming home.
Le George, our forever favorite never disappoints. And as Riccardo and I wander through the heart of this city, we know one thing for certain: no matter how much time passes, there is no better place to be in Paris than here, where every stay feels like a love letter to the timeless beauty of Paris and you feel like stepping into a dream, where luxury and history intertwine effortlessly.

Until next time, George V—you will always have a place in our heart.

Until next time, George V—you will always have a place in our heart.

text.text:
My partner and I had a 3 course meal & drinks here and the service was impeccable. The food and drinks were perfection - best cocktail I’ve ever had!
They knew we were English and communicated with us clearly. The wait staff even made jokes and genuinely seemed to love their job.
Highly recommend the matcha tea - that’s an experience!
I can’t wait to go back one day! Highly recommend the whole experience of this restaurant.

text.text: The Four Seasons in Paris is undeniably a stunning and well-organized hotel, with an elegant atmosphere and impeccable attention to detail. The property itself is a true representation of luxury, featuring beautiful rooms and exquisite decor that add to the overall experience. However, despite the hotel’s physical beauty, we were disappointed by the lack of warmth and personal connection from the staff. While professional, the staff seemed distant, and we often felt that even simple requests were met with reluctance, making everything feel more difficult than it should have been. We expected a more welcoming and accommodating environment that matched the hotel’s high standards, but unfortunately, that wasn’t the case. For a hotel of this caliber, the hospitality left much to be desired.

originalText.text: The Four Seasons in Paris is undeniably a stunning and well-organized hotel, with an elegant atmosphere and impeccable attention to detail. The property itself is a true representation of luxury, featuring beautiful rooms and exquisite decor that add to the overall experience. While professional, the staff seemed distant, and we often felt that even simple requests were met with reluctance, making everything feel more difficult than it should have been. We expected a more welcoming and accommodating environment that matched the hotel’s high standards, but unfortunately, that wasn’t the case. For a hotel of this caliber, the hospitality left much to be desired.

displayName.text: Prince de Galles, a Luxury Collection Hotel, Paris

name: places/ChIJVSOS5FBv5kcRmaCCdrMCfk4
adrFormatAddress: 15 Pl. Vendôme, 75001 Paris, France

editorialSummary.text: Renowned luxury hotel with posh quarters & upscale dining, plus a chic spa & a gym.

text.text:
Staying at The Ritz Paris was an absolutely unforgettable experience. We arrived late in the evening, but from the moment we stepped inside, we were warmly welcomed and made to feel at home. The level of service here is truly exceptional—every detail is attended to with such care and elegance.

Our room was the epitome of comfort and luxury, with beautifully designed interiors, plush furnishings, and thoughtful touches throughout. The swan-shaped taps in the marble bathroom were a charming detail, and the thick, luxurious towels added to the feeling of pure indulgence. After a long journey, sinking into the heavenly bed was exactly what we needed!

Dining at L’Espadon, the hotel’s restaurant, was an absolute highlight. The food was exquisite, every dish perfectly prepared, and the service was flawless—attentive without being intrusive. One evening, we opted for a more relaxed atmosphere at Bar Hemingway, and it was just as delightful. The cocktails were beautifully crafted, and the ambiance was warm and intimate.

Every moment at The Ritz Paris felt special. It’s not just a hotel—it’s an experience, a perfect blend of history, elegance, and impeccable service. If you’re looking for the ultimate Parisian luxury stay, this is it!

text.text: The atmosphere is nice. But there were no sophisticated cakes, just very simple cookies and pastries. No salty option like little sandwiches. You are proposed only one individual teapot of tea, thus you may choose only one sort of tea. We have been in other places where were prepared several teapots of tea so you have the opportunity to try different sorts during the evening.

text.text:
My family and I are vacationing in Paris. Having stayed multiple times at Ritz-Carlton hotels and being big fans, we decided to visit the original Ritz Hotel in Paris. Our plan was to enjoy a cup of coffee and some desserts, but the staff’s behavior left us uncomfortable—they stared at us as if we had asked for directions to Mars.

As we walked through the lobby, we noticed a tall man in a suit following us, treating us as though we were a threat. To clarify, we’ve stayed at similar high-end hotels before, and having someone tail us while we quietly walked through the lobby is excessive.

I understand the importance of prioritizing guest security, but if manners are part of your corporate values and staff training, I recommend an additional focus on professionalism and courtesy.

text.text: Absolutely incredible experience at a top hotel.  Elegant public areas, rooms that are spacious and super clean!  Fantastic dining!  I could go on and on!  Definitely a bucket list destination.  Please note, if it bothers you to spend 30 Euro on a cocktail and you complain about the expense in a review, please don’t stay here!  It’s one of the best hotels in the world and not for those on a budget.  Highly recommended!

text.text:
Located in Place Vendome. It is good for shopping in Cambonga or going to the Louvre, but the location on Avenue Montaigne seems to be the best.

While staying in the deluxe junior suite, I experienced luxury and comfort that matched the expensive price.

The staff were all very friendly.

If you prefer traditional European beauty and luxury, Ritz Paris is an excellent choice.

name: places/ChIJt4LY5C1u5kcRZmZx4KyzhVM
adrFormatAddress: 2 Rue Scribe, 75009 Paris, France

displayName.text: InterContinental Paris - Le Grand, an IHG Hotel

editorialSummary.text: Lavish lodging with opera house views & a renowned restaurant, plus a spa & a fitness room.

text.text: Stayed for three days on a work trip, and the hotel delivered exactly what you’d expect from a classic five-star in central Paris—old-school elegance, classy rooms, and excellent service. The real standout, though, was breakfast. The scrambled eggs had a perfect consistency with just the right balance of creaminess, the hollandaise sauce was surprisingly airy with well-balanced acidity, and the bread pudding was incredibly rich in both flavor and texture. Not everything was exceptional, and the selection could be broader, but those three dishes made a lasting impression. Overall, a great stay.

originalText.text: Stayed for three days on a work trip, and the hotel delivered exactly what you’d expect from a classic five-star in central Paris—old-school elegance, classy rooms, and excellent service. The real standout, though, was breakfast. The scrambled eggs had a perfect consistency with just the right balance of creaminess, the hollandaise sauce was surprisingly airy with well-balanced acidity, and the bread pudding was incredibly rich in both flavor and texture. Not everything was exceptional, and the selection could be broader, but those three dishes made a lasting impression. Overall, a great stay.

text.text:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Intercontinental Le Grand, and I must say, Elias at the reception made my experience truly exceptional. From the moment I arrived, he greeted me with a warm smile and a genuine willingness to help. His knowledge of the hotel and the surrounding area was impressive, providing me with great recommendations for dining and sightseeing.

Elias went above and beyond to ensure my stay was comfortable, promptly addressing any questions I had and even assisting with my luggage. His professionalism and friendly demeanor made me feel valued as a guest. It's rare to encounter someone who is not only proficient in their job but also passionate about making guests feel welcome. I highly recommend the Intercontinental Le Grand, and if you have the chance to meet Elias.

text.text: I liked the hotel, especially its palace design. Thanks to Paul from the reception for his care and great hospitality. The best location, i feel special in the hotel . and special thanks to the guys - concierges, they easily solved all the issues

originalText.text: I liked the hotel, especially its palace design. Thanks to Paul from the reception for his care and great hospitality. The best location, i feel special in the hotel . and special thanks to the guys - concierges, they easily solved all the issues

text.text:
The building and interior is historic and beautiful.

It was a busy time at the end of the year, but we couldn't get into our room until an hour after check-in time.
And the concierge atitude was rude.

We chose a room with a view of the Opera, but we could only see a little by leaning out onto the balcony.
There were coffee sets in the room, but no cups.
There were a few hairs in the bathroom.
But the king size bed was a great.

The biggest shock was the breakfast.
We are an Asian family, but we were rudely ushered to the stairs at the entrance, and shortly afterwards we saw a French-speaking family of the same size as us being politely led to a good seat.
There were only Asian families around the stairs. It was surprising, but it happened.

I really questioned whether this was 5-star service in all respects, so I decided to leave a review here.

The reason I didn't give it one star is because we met 3 great doormen and waiters.

text.text:
This is a perfect location and an amazing hotel!
The staff is amazing and friendly!
We loved the ambassador club
And the neighborhood cannot be beat! Right next to Lafayette and Printemps.
The Cafe de la Paix breakfast is amazing! Don’t miss it
Our only downside was that there are no refrigerators in the rooms. This was a problem as we had medication that needed to be kept cold

editorialSummary.text: Opulent rooms with art & antiques, plus a fine-dining restaurant, a lounge & a bar.

text.text:
A wonderful, smaller hotel in a great location.

Staff are very friendly, front desk / concierge service offered helpful tourist advice and were able to book excellent restaurant reservations.

Breakfast option in the hotel is also highly recommended for its quality and hospitality.

text.text: Such a beautiful, historic, luxurious and classy hotel in an amazing location. The staff are wonderful and will do everything in order for your stay to be perfect. The rooms are spacious, newly renovated, beautifully decorated, lovely amenities (Diptyque)! I’d love to stay here again!!

text.text:
Great hotel. Staff was super hospitable and friendly. Room was clean and comfortable. Breakfast was delicious and the bar area was a cozy spot to enjoy an ice cold 🍺 local beer
Thanks!

originalText.text:
Great hotel. Staff was super hospitable and friendly. Room was clean and comfortable. Breakfast was delicious and the bar area was a cozy spot to enjoy an ice cold 🍺 local beer
Thanks!

text.text: This was a fantastic experience. From the moment we arrived, Laetitia, Jerome, and their team were so kind and welcoming. Not only were we able to check in early after a long international flight, but we also received a room upgrade. Twice throughout the stay, we received notes wishing me a happy birthday and a pleasant stay. They even gifted us a bottle of champagne the second night. First class experience! I only wish we were able to spend more time at this hotel. Breakfast was included! And it was a full hot breakfast, where you could select whatever you liked. Seeing the cost on the menu for someone not staying there, this was a tremendous value. I'm so sad this is no longer part of the Hyatt hotel program, but given the opportunity to come back, we would save up and stay here for sure! It is located on a quiet street, but near enough to the metro and the Champs-Élysées that it was very convenient and walkable. Merci beaucoup!

originalText.text: This was a fantastic experience. From the moment we arrived, Laetitia, Jerome, and their team were so kind and welcoming. Not only were we able to check in early after a long international flight, but we also received a room upgrade. Twice throughout the stay, we received notes wishing me a happy birthday and a pleasant stay. They even gifted us a bottle of champagne the second night. First class experience! I only wish we were able to spend more time at this hotel. Breakfast was included! And it was a full hot breakfast, where you could select whatever you liked. Seeing the cost on the menu for someone not staying there, this was a tremendous value. I'm so sad this is no longer part of the Hyatt hotel program, but given the opportunity to come back, we would save up and stay here for sure! It is located on a quiet street, but near enough to the metro and the Champs-Élysées that it was very convenient and walkable. Merci beaucoup!

text.text:
The best review I can give is that I would return to Paris just to stay at this hotel.

A truly luxury experience in a unique, boutique-style hotel, with world-class service that you would expect to pay double the price (or more) for.

We were there for4 nights celebrating a 5th wedding anniversary and the staff went above and beyond to take care of us and make our stay special.

At the end of long, hard walking days seeing the city, there was nothing like walking through the doors of the hotel, walking through the beautiful lobby, getting back to the room and taking a hot bath, putting on a plush robe, being fully relaxed, and getting a fantastic sleep in one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in.

On top of that, you are just a few minutes walk from two Metro stations and all of the shopping you could ever want, plus just 5 minutes from a great view of the Tower and the Arc.

We stayed in 3 wonderful hotels on this trip and this is the only one I'm bothering writing a review for because it was so memorable.

Thank you San Régis!

name: places/ChIJUVJY3Ddv5kcRlFyqerxxoeA
adrFormatAddress: 228 Rue de Rivoli, 75001 Paris, France

editorialSummary.text: Opulent quarters in a regal hotel offering 2 upscale restaurants, a bar & a patisserie, plus a spa.

text.text: This review is solely for the restaurant portion of the hotel. The breakfast here came highly recommended and I now know why. This was one of the best experiences we have ever had. Our server was incredible and so accommodating. The food was just amazing - I think I will dream of the scrambled eggs until I get back there again. Absolute perfection in every way. I really can't say enough good things. Beautiful setting, beautiful presentation of food, and incredible service. We had such a good experience at breakfast we ended our day here as well with dessert and a nightcap before heading back to our hotel. That experience was nothing short of amazing, as well.

originalText.text: This review is solely for the restaurant portion of the hotel. The breakfast here came highly recommended and I now know why. This was one of the best experiences we have ever had. I really can't say enough good things. Beautiful setting, beautiful presentation of food, and incredible service. We had such a good experience at breakfast we ended our day here as well with dessert and a nightcap before heading back to our hotel. That experience was nothing short of amazing, as well.

text.text: Beautiful aesthetic. Lovely staff. Helpful concierge. Best breakfast I’ve ever had. Been coming here for years and will continue to do so. Also, the location is great as well. A lot of things to do within walking distance.

originalText.text: Beautiful aesthetic. Lovely staff. Helpful concierge. Best breakfast I’ve ever had. Been coming here for years and will continue to do so. Also, the location is great as well. A lot of things to do within walking distance.

text.text: An unforgettable dining experience! The flavors, presentation, and service were all top-notch. Definitely worth the Michelin stars.

originalText.text: An unforgettable dining experience! The flavors, presentation, and service were all top-notch. Definitely worth the Michelin stars.

text.text: I had a wonderful experience at the hotel, thanks to Fredrick! He was incredibly professional, attentive, and went above and beyond to make my stay comfortable. His warm and friendly demeanor made a great impression. Excellent service—I truly appreciate his hospitality!

originalText.text: I had a wonderful experience at the hotel, thanks to Fredrick! He was incredibly professional, attentive, and went above and beyond to make my stay comfortable. His warm and friendly demeanor made a great impression. Excellent service—I truly appreciate his hospitality!

text.text:
Wow, where do I even begin?! ✨ Le Meurice is pure magic! From the moment I stepped into this dreamy oasis in the heart of Paris, I knew I was in for something extraordinary. The location? Absolutely perfect! You’re surrounded by the city's vibrant energy, with all the iconic spots right at your fingertips. 🌍✨

But let’s talk about the food – WOW. The desserts? Each bite is like a sweet little piece of heaven. 🍰💫 The lunch – fresh, flavorful, and so satisfying. You’ll be dreaming of it long after you leave! 😋

And don't even get me started on tea time – it's an experience, not just a meal! 🍵🌿 Every detail is just so thoughtfully put together, making you feel like you’ve stumbled into a beautiful little world of calm and indulgence.

If you're looking for  luxury vibes, Le Meurice is the place to be!  I’ll definitely be back for more of that sweet Parisian magic!
